content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)  
• Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)  
 – Connected secondary components: a burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) and an assembling-machine-1 at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

### Depot Belt System at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Belt depot wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)  
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)  
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction RIGHT (adjacent placement with the chest)

### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Steam engine at Position(x=–0.5, y=24.5)  
• Boiler at Position(x=–5.5, y=24.0)  
• Offshore pump at Position(x=–7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Issues  
 – When connecting transport belts, avoid targeting a steam engine directly. Always insert an inserter between the belt and the steam engine to serve as the valid target.

• Entity Placement Distance Error  
 – If placement fails because the target is “too far away” (e.g. wooden chest at (3.5,15.5)), ensure the player moves sufficiently close to the placement location before attempting to place the entity.

• Inventory Shortage During Placement  
 – When an error indicates that the required item (e.g. wooden chest) is missing from inventory, verify that the inventory contains the item before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Error  
 – A NameError (e.g. ‘target_chest’ not defined) suggests that variable names must be reviewed and matched exactly to their definitions.
